solution.text:
First, let us substitute the value of \(x=\frac {-_{k}_}{_{j}_}\,\) in \(p(x) = (_{j}_x+_{k}_)(_{l}_x-_{m}_)\,\), we get,
\(p(\frac{-_{k}_}{_{j}_}) = ((_{j}_ \times \frac {-_{k}_}{_{j}_})+_{k}_)((_{l}_ \times \frac {-_{k}_}{_{j}_})-_{m}_)\)
\(\Rightarrow p(\frac{-_{k}_}{_{j}_}) = (_{k}_-_{k}_)((_{l}_ \times \frac {-_{k}_}{_{j}_})-_{m}_)\)
\(\Rightarrow p(\frac{-_{k}_}{_{j}_}) = 0 \times ((_{l}_ \times \frac {-_{k}_}{_{j}_})-_{m}_)= 0\)
Therefore, \(x=\frac{-_{k}_}{_{j}_}\,\) is a zero of the polynomial \(p(x) = (_{j}_x+_{k}_)(_{l}_x-_{m}_)\)
Similarly, Substitute the value of \(x=\frac {_{m}_}{_{l}_}\,\) in \(p(x)\),
The value of \(p(x)\,\) obtained will be \(0\).
Thus, \(x=\frac{_{m}_}{_{l}_}\,\) is a zero of the polynomial \(p(x) = (_{j}_x+_{k}_)(_{l}_x-_{m}_)\)
